page.title: 12Bowthorpe (continued)
page.content:
and the final one, yet to come, will be called Three Score. The housing is mixed private and local authority, and built to a much higher density than nearby New Costessey.
At present there are two schools, Clover Hill First, and St Michaels Middle; pupils feed into the Norwich City Comprehensive Schools system at the age of 12.
There is concern at present because, being a new housing area, there is a much higher than average number of children of school age, and the local authority wishes to use up spare capacity in middle schools in less favoured areas nearby ratther than build further capacity at Bowthorpe.
